author: thhddnordr
title: Cardano NFT Art Festival
description: There are language and cultural gaps to adopting Cardano. The ++best way to bridge++ cultural and language barriers is through ++creating NFT art.++

f6_assessments.q0: While I think the problem statement and solution does not quite match the content of the roadmap of this proposal, the proposed project addresses the challenge in that it will further develop an ongoing project that translates and provides information about Catalyst and Cardano to a Japanese community. The roadmap moreso indicates, that the team will be providing workshops and an active online discourse about NFTs in relation to Cardano, including setting up an Art Festival at the end of the projects roadmap. So basically, most of the possible directions for this challenge will be addressed: creating educational material (in this case about NFTs), getting people together, translation and education.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers provide an already active website as well as a twitter handle to look up the current state of the outreach program. So I find it highly likely, that the team will be able to put more work into their programme with additional funding.
The team would like to add several NFT themed educational programmes as well as an NFT Art Festival. The information provided about the team points to an already active following that will be the targeted audience for the development of the NFT program. The proposal does not indicate that the team has prior experience with NFTs and it does not indicate how well the team is connected in the art/NFT space and how they intend to reach out to possible artists for the festival. Generally, this proposal is very clear in how it will provide educational content and a platform to discuss NFTs, the proposal - however - does not provide any information on how they are planning on setting up an art festival. So basically, the scope of the proposal shifted during writing and is focussing mostly on creating an NFT themed website with educational content and workshops - with the goal of setting up an Art Festival.
It would have been interesting to find out more about the connections between the english and the japanese community, as it is mentioned a couple times in the proposal and "bridging" seems like a great idea to not create isolate spaces but rather try to merge communities that are divided by their language. I´m not quite sure if the proposers refer to the running website or if they are planning on creating a new website.
f6_assessments.q2: The budget is broken down somewhat broad and with the "solution statement" referring to an Art Festival there should be funds allocated for the festival. So far, the funding is only for the website including the graphic design of the website as well as some marketing. If working with national and international artists as mentioned, the team should provide some goals for this Art Festival and also would have to break down the budget for this, including for the artists that they would like to work with. The roadmap and the goals included are feasable and auditable and will be transparent through discord and the website.

f6_assessments.q0: In the late 20th century, global population knew of Japan from its electronics brands. By the last few decades, most were drawn to its culture primarily via the visual Japanese representation of anime & manga. I agree that an NFT Art Festival not only effectively belongs to this challenge but it is an apt event in more ways than one. There is an opportunity presented by this proposal that could not only lead to further adoption and a more widespread awareness of ADA but one where our CNFT community can benefit from with creative Japanese-inspired artworks.
f6_assessments.q1: The qualifications of the two main proposers are very-well detailed and are both in line with the event being proposed. Yuki seems to be a proven provider of translated-to-Japanese Cardano resources with links to currently published outputs included in the proposal. Timothy seems to have the experience to organise such an event and the main bridge between the two cultures. Furthermore, his network appears to be large in scope that he may well succeed in bringing Cardano awareness to people who are not commonly part of our crypto-world. This can only be beneficial. The fact that the pair have been conducting Telegram/Discord sessions already adds to the probability for success as they would have surely learnt how to run such an event. There is already a regular captive audience which can hopefully grow larger when it eventually occurs. As someone who had assessed tenders for a university institution in a previous life, I can attest that the qualifications of the proposers, their previous experiences and on-going Cardano commitment are all recipes for success. I agree that this proposal will be implemented successfully if given the opportunity.
f6_assessments.q2: There's a fair bit of planning projections, costings and pathway provided to enable auditability of this proposal. The two proposers seemingly approach their Cardano-related work on a part-time basis and this may well be the rationale for a year-long deployment of the project. Nonetheless, there are significant milestones established on the 3, 6 and 12 month marks which will allow Project Catalyst to assess its progress. This bodes well for the proposal. There isn't much I can suggest to this proposal to further improve it and it is a testament to how well it is presented. My only recommendation is for the general Cardano Community to join the Telegram/Discord channels even of you are not a native Japanese speaker as you may well gain an understanding of this growing community. You never know, you may well benefit from its impending CNFTs with an early look-in. Good luck.

f6_assessments.q0: This idea meets very well what the challenge seeks, because it intends to create a website that will, as I understand it, encourage debate about NFT Art on platforms such as discord, telegram and zoom, aimed at the Japanese community. The authors also intend to promote in-person festivals, but I believe that only after the project moves forward, that is, that the first investments are made and the target audience grows larger and consolidates. It is positive that the authors already have an extensive work of translating content involving the Cardano ecosystem into Japanese, which demonstrates their involvement with the cause. It is also important as they already have a good number of people in their communities, which would make project execution simpler as they already have a potential audience. What I thought here was that, I don't understand why it would be necessary to create a website to leverage such discussions; they could be promoted on the portals they already make available. I would like to understand a little more about the functionality of this site, what else would it have in terms of content? I believe the authors used a lot of space to explain their previous activities and who they are, but they didn't explain the core of the project, that is, the website. Why would he be that bridge, how would he break down cultural barriers and so on. I would like more details on this.
f6_assessments.q1: The best part of the proposal was undoubtedly the presentation of the authors. We know their names and in great detail several things they did before, what their relationship is both with the Cardano ecosystem and with Japan. About this part, there is nothing to criticize. Full confidence in the authors' ability to successfully execute the project is given. Regarding the script, they do not establish phases to be followed with duly detailed activities, what we have here are the definitions of success. Through this topic, we have a sense of what would happen in each quarter, but it is not enough to have a solid understanding of what will happen during the construction of the project itself. I suggest that the authors make a division of phases (per month is a good idea) and mention: what will be done, who would do it, for how many days, so that... I wish it were useful, the process will be better understood. Regarding the financial division, I believe that the same problem occurs. We know how the money will be distributed, but this is done in a rather shallow way, the division is very macro. For example: "$3677 for website design and graphics". It's a good amount, how will this design be built? What will be done besides the website interface? Would they hire a professional in the area? In my view, there was a lack of detail both in the construction of the phases and in this financial division, so a review in this part of the proposal is necessary.
f6_assessments.q2: Through the definitions of success given by the authors, it is possible to exercise good auditability. We could set up a small community group to have meetings with them to show them the progress of the project, and the feedback could be taken out to the rest of the community. It would be interesting if the people chosen to monitor the project were also Japanese speakers. Another thing that would be important is that the authors themselves provide data on how access to the site would be, how much their communities (in discord, etc.) would be growing, if there really would be a significant number of people adopting technologies from our ecosystem (in this case , the use of NFT). It is important that they give this feedback in English, as most people in the community do not speak Japanese. Thus, I believe that the authors did provide pertinent information for future monitoring, it is enough that the community itself engages in monitoring the construction of the site and that they themselves bring feedback on the number of accesses and new users of our blockchain, through of digital assets. I just don't give top marks because of the absence of this "bridge", but we already have the information.

f6_assessments.q0:
I strongly agree to the proposal, why 
 because the real problem needed to be solves has been identified and fallin within the scope of the challenge.

 the proposal has added a great value to the cardano ecosystem and key metrics and goals of the proposal has also fallin within the scope of the challenge.

the proposer has scale to address future challengies.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal has provide evidence. reference, links and vidios with relevant skills and experience needed to implement this proposal if funded.

Th proposal has identifiably listed in manner the type and number of team memeber needde to implement the proposal and has rationally laid out the team structures and break downs.

 Budget has out lined clearly and break down into identifiable items reasonably to achieve the set goals of this proposal.

The proposal has a realistic time table and has provided a conductive plan for implementation and the plan describes the the resource needed to get the project to a success.
f6_assessments.q2:
Strongly agree because road maps and time horizons has been proven, and clearly denfined metrics with KPI's the defines to success of the proposal.

 understandable describtion of the targeted problem and understandable solutions to address it.

has a contency plans put in place for the chievement of the project

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal certainly fits the challenge description. There is a big language barrier between the English and Japanese communities. By making art the language between the Japanese and English communities you can close the communication gap. The only thing that is missing is a better explanation of your solution. It is missing a clear perspective.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer states that he has the relevant experience but gives no reference links to support this. Looking at the link provided in the proposal there are key documents in Japanese to help the Japanese community. 2 people are behind this proposal but we don't know if they need to hire extra team members to make this successful. Seeing the experience both members have they will probably need to hire members for the design of the website and development, but there is no mention of this. The budget breakdown also sents of a red flag for me in the sense that you have some random budget that adds up to exactly 10000 USD. A great proposal but there is not enough info to see this being successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap provided gives a clear view of what to expect from the proposal, but we are missing some metrics that go along with this. How many active users do you wish to have in 3/6/12 months? What KPI's do you have for the festival? How many artists do you plan on having at the festival?

f6_assessments.q0: Cardano NFT Art festival addresses the challenge connecting Japanese community using NFT art to bridge the language and culture gap to adopting Cardano. This will be done through annual NFT art event and it should be able to scale the impact in future.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer team is comprised of a Cardano Ambassador and an experienced event organiser. The budget is outlined clearly and reasonable enough to carry out the plan. It also explains how this will be done in the beginning as virtual event then turn to in person attendance.
f6_assessments.q2: The community can audit if the proposal has carried out the activities as mentioned in 3 months, 6 months and 12 months timeline as planned. The roadmap and milestones are straightforward and easy for the community to see through the successful implementation.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal is in the challenge target because I think this implementation will be core to the Cardano community which will help any developer to get into the Cardano playing field and grow in the future. Create NFT art to overcome cultural and language barriers. In my opinion, this is a great idea and it perfectly meets this challenge.
Problems and solutions are clearly presented and easy to understand. Connect the Japanese/British community with the annual virtual Cardano NFT art festival in Japan featuring local/international artists. As far as I know Japan is a country that loves festivals, so this proposal will attract many people to learn about Cardano
f6_assessments.q1:
The need and the end goal are very clearly explained as the definition of success. The team has been working to engage the Japanese community by translating important articles, videos, documents....for their 1500+ members. In addition, there were also the participation of 4 interpreters: Japan Volunteer Support Conference and Cardano Japan Community Membership Discount Conference. The suggested solution is to create a website that focuses on making NFT and art the center of conversation in a forum, this is a great idea and I believe this suggestion will be appreciated high. solved because a team with community plus proven experience can complete this challenge
The proposed team of 2, although they did not lead a personal link so that we could track their experience as well as their work and education, the proposed group's qualifications were provided. and strongly support the proponents who have a lot of experience and capacity to carry out this project.
The minus point is that the proponent does not present any information about the potential risks and challenges that they may face while implementing the project.
f6_assessments.q2:
Roadmaps provide project plans that provide information on how goals will be achieved within certain time frames (3 months, 6 months, 12 months), if possible to be broken down to help community copper easier to audit
Proposal propose 1/5 of the budget of the whole challenge and list specific expenses, I think it makes perfect sense
I appreciate the feasibility of the proposal, but no specific KPIs or data are in place to help us measure what success will look like.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is about organizing an Annual Cardano NFT Art Festival in Japan with local/international artists. This is an interesting idea. The problem is clearly described and explained in detail. The solution is clearly described with specific milestones.
Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge, I can rate it with a score of 5
f6_assessments.q1:
Although this webpage [https://coinzzz.jp/] is only written in Japanese, however, with google translator, your team's works can be seen. Proposer and other team members' profiles should be described with links for verification. Because this proposal is related to organizing a Festival so ability as an event organizer is required. The KPIs.metrics were not provided. The budget structure remains very abstract, this should be explained in detail. Besides, the risk is not provided [organizing an event may face the risk of change of context condition, like: lockdown/pandemic, for example].
Therefore, based on the given information, I am neutral with this proposal's feasibility, and give it a score of 3
f6_assessments.q2:
There is some lack of information: (1)Team profile; (2) Each team member's profile; (3) Budget explanations of calculation base for each item; (4) KPIs/ Metrics.
Therefore, based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's auditability, I can rate it with a score of 2

f6_assessments.q0: I think it is effective. There are many ADA holders in Japan, but many of them have little involvement in the community. Therefore, it is necessary to hold an event to activate their involvement. And I think NFT is the most interesting theme. However, I don't think it is an issue that needs to be resolved immediately. In conclusion, I give a rating of 4.
f6_assessments.q1: The feasibility is high. They have excellent team members and have good connections with the Japanese community. Also, they are also foreigners but have a good understanding of the situation in Japan. And they already have the resources to connect NFT artists to the Japanese community. In conclusion, I give a rating of 5.
f6_assessments.q2: Auditability is not sufficient. The roadmap and KPI settings are generally ambiguous. In particular, auditing is not easy because KPIs are not specified clearly. In conclusion, I give a rating of 2.

solution: We will bridge Japanese/English communities with an Annual Cardano NFT Art Festival in Japan with local/international artists.
experience:
8 years Accountant in Japan/Cardano Ambassador/Catalyst Fund 2 Proposer
11 Years Project Manager/8 Years Events Coordinator for the DOD
